Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Version component of package details page URL is case sensitive" (#7154) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Compare the version selected between these two URLs:

https://www.nuget.org/packages/NUnit/3.0.0-rc-3
https://www.nuget.org/packages/NUnit/3.0.0-RC-3

Both should show `3.0.0-rc-3` selected.

This line is the problem.
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/9501b3539f893e6011a89120fd5a9b65a8420d86/src/NuGetGallery/Controllers/PackagesController.cs#L723

It is operating on a materialized list and uses a function that can't be mapped to SQL. Both are indicators that the string comparison is done in app code (case sensitive) not SQL Server (case insensitive in our collation).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Uploading symbols when you are not allowed to upload symbols shows broken UI instead of error" (#6956) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Locally, I tried to upload symbols for the first time and noticed a strange behavior. The verify form became filled with empty data, and submitting the form shows a strange error.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18014088/53828438-82fc5380-3f32-11e9-95e8-5880aa496c2a.png)

Digging into this a bit it appears that [the backend returned an error](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/master/src/NuGetGallery/Controllers/PackagesController.cs#L392) because I did not have symbols enabled in `Symbols-Configuration.json`, but that the client-side UI didn't properly show it.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18014088/53828359-43ce0280-3f32-11e9-843b-152c01ae725c.png)

It's very likely that this will happen in other symbols validation failure cases returned by [`SymbolPackageUploadService.ValidateUploadedSymbolsPackage`](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/master/src/NuGetGallery/Services/SymbolPackageUploadService.cs#L53).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[GitHub] Design review" (#7184) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "Work around Chromium bug that gives false positives during accessibility pass" (#7183) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Related to https://github.com/microsoft/accessibility-insights-web/issues/692
Related to https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=647594

This is a workaround suggested by the Accessibility Insights team (the tool formerly known as Keros). This means there is less noise in our accessibility passes using this tool.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "RemoveVulnerabilityDataFromPackageDeprecationModel.Down should recreate dbo.PackageDeprecations_CVSSRating constraint" (#7182) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "RemoveVulnerabilityDataFromPackageDeprecationModel.Down should recreate dbo.PackageDeprecations_CVSSRating constraint" (#7181) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We remove the constraint in [`Up`](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/55c1733b792b774d6772f15f96b9f7a35ff3f45d/src/NuGetGallery/Migrations/201904292139301_RemoveVulnerabilityDataFromPackageDeprecationModel.cs#L20) but do not recreate it in `Down`.

This was the cause of https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/commit/55c1733b792b774d6772f15f96b9f7a35ff3f45d

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "HOTFIX: Only drop the CVSSRating if it exists" (#7180) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "HOTFIX: Only drop the CVSSRating if it exists" (#7180) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Application Insights said a 401 occurred, client observes 403" (#7179) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
1. Create an API key with a non `*` scope (e.g. `Test.*`)
1. Push a package that doesn't match the scope (e.g. `Real.MyCoolPackage`) with nuget.exe
1. Notice the output is a 403 Forbidden.
1. Look at AI logs for this request. You'll see it is a 401.

This suggests our AI does not match real life. This is scary since who knows what other lies are in our AI.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PMC tab completion is incorrect when there is no space after & or ." (#8158) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):
Package Manager Console

VS version (if appropriate):
15.9.12

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):
17763.504

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:
Never worked before

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

Using ``&``
1. Type ``&$pro``
2. Press ``Tab`` and auto-complete
3. Result is ``$profile`` but should be ``&$profile``

Using ``.``
1. Type ``.$pro``
2. Press ``Tab`` and auto-complete
3. Result is ``.profile`` but should be ``.$profile``

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet restoration of MsBuild SDKs is extremely buggy" (#8157) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm creating a custom MsBuild SDK and when I use it in my project, Visual Studio (2017 & 2019) has the following issues happening intermittently until everything eventually works:
- VS hangs.
- The project using the custom SDK will be unloaded. Reloading it will cause a hang.
- A strange window also appears running `CredentialProvider.Microsoft.exe`:
![msbuild-sdk-vs-issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9839187/58295510-709cf380-7d84-11e9-8f93-794d63a8335d.PNG)

Eventually, after restarting VS a couple times, everything works.

Azure DevOps's dotnet restore doesn't work at all: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/581357/dotnetcorecli.html

I'm getting issues with running dotnet locally as well but it partially (if not entirely) due to https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/6045

The same NuGet package can be restored without problem if I add it to my csproj as a `<PackageReference />`.

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used:
- dotnet.exe
- Azure DevOps's DotNetCoreCLI@2 restore with NuGet.config
- VS UI

NuGet version: Whatever dotnet 2.2.102 uses

dotnet.exe --version: 2.2.102

VS version: 2017 (15) & 2019 (16)

OS version: win10 1803 17134.407 & Azure DevOps

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create an MsBuild SDK project, generate a NuGet package, and push it to a stream.

2. Use the `<Project Sdk="...">` attribute to reference your MsBuild SDK and specify the version of the Sdk via `global.json`. Alternatively, add the MsBuild SDK in [any of the ways specified in the documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/msbuild/how-to-use-project-sdk?view=vs-2019).

3. Watch everything burn.


## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

None.

### Sample Project

TODO

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Make the Settings reading in VS lazy" (#8156) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
There are certain actions such as solution open/close that require a settings refresh. 
We should not refresh the config when the solution event is fired because it will be on the UI thread.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "FrameworkReferences testing is disabled" (#8155) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: The testing for packing projects with FrameworkReferences (PackCommand_PackProject_PacksFrameworkReferences) is disabled for now.  It needs to be enabled in branch  dev-feature-xplatVerification when targeting to netstandar2.1.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "dotnet-list-package in a UnitTest project returns an error" (#8154) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @wmorian on Thursday, 23 May 2019 10:37:20_

## Steps to reproduce
create a new xunit project:
  `dotnet new xunit`

The referenced packages are:
```xml 
<ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk" Version="16.0.1" />
    <PackageReference Include="xunit" Version="2.4.0" />
    <PackageReference Include="xunit.runner.visualstudio" Version="2.4.0" />
</ItemGroup>
```

restore project:
`dotnet restore`

list all packages
`dotnet list package`


## Expected  behavior
```
λ  dotnet list package
Project 'ListPackageUnitTest' has the following package references
   [netcoreapp2.2]:
   Top-level Package                   Requested   Resolved
   > Microsoft.NETCore.App       (A)   [2.2.0, )   2.2.0
   > xunit                             2.4.0       2.4.0
   > xunit.runner.visualstudio         2.4.0       2.4.0
```

## Actual behavior
```
λ  dotnet list package
error: Sequence contains more than one element
```

## Note
If I comment out Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk, then I got no error!


## Environment data
`dotnet --info` output:


Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "solution based cache for packagereference" (#8153) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I have targets on my packages that modify my assemblies before build in relation to project references. This worked well with the packages.config as the the default cache  is project based. However with packages config my consumer my have patch the same assemblies from difference solutions as the cache now is global. 

Is there a workaround to this problem?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Download specific package with its dependencies to a folder" (#8152) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

Can't find a way to download a package with its dependencies into a specified folder for offline use.

NuGet product used: dotnet.exe

NuGet version: 5.1.0.0

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate): 3.0.100-preview5-011568

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: 3.5.0.1996

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
`dotnet add package <PACKAGE NAME> --package-directory .` does not have an option to download package and its dependencies without passing a project file.

### Verbose Logs

`dotnet add package Gradient --package-directory .`

> Could not find any project in `C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Local\Temp\NuInstall\`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Manage NuGet Packages dialog shows 'Authors' of package but not 'Owners'" (#442) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I have a question about why the package ‘Authors’ is listed in the data shown when looking at a package in Visual Studio through the “Manage NuGet Packages” dialog. The “Authors” is just an arbitrary string that could be filled in with anything. From trust perspective as a package consumer what I really want to know is who the ‘Owners’ or publishers of the package are.

For example if you look up the Xerces package in Visual Studio you see it says ‘The Apache Software Foundation’. I might think oh great it looks like it is published by the owner of the library. However if you actually go to the NuGet.org site and look at the package the owner is someone completely different, Kikuchi. From a package trusting perspective this is bad. I need to see front and center who the owner of the package is, since the author is just a meaningless string that could contain any value.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "nuget list & add commands are being deprecated in 5.0" (#34) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Tracking Issue(s):
* Deprecate ambiguous nuget.exe commands in 5.0 [#7753](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7753)
  * Deprecate nuget.exe add command [#7923](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7923)
  * Rename nuget.exe list to nuget.exe search [#7912](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7912)

The following commands are being deprecated because these are cause of confusion due to their nomenclature and/or other related commands that already exist:
* [`nuget list`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/tools/cli-ref-list): Currently displays a list of packages from a given source
  * This will be replaced by an equivalent command **`nuget search`** which will be later enhanced with more capabilities as we make progress with or [search improvements](nvmd got it: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/6371​​​​​​​).
* [`nuget add`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/tools/cli-ref-add): Currently adds a specified package to a non-HTTP package source (a folder or UNC path) in a hierarchical layout, wherein folders are created for the package ID and version number. 
  * This will be replaced by overloading **`nuget push`** command.

> These commands will be deprecated i.e. there will be a warning on usage of these commands in 5.0 so that in future releases these commands can be discontinued.
